title: Nona-binning and Tetra-binning explained: What are these features on the Galaxy S22 camera?
content:
Pixel binning is a term that’s become increasingly frequent when talking about smartphone cameras in recent years, and it goes hand in hand with the ever-increasing camera resolution of some phones. Most Android phones these days have 48MP, 50MP, even 108MP sensors, and most of them have some form of pixel binning. For example, the

The post Nona-binning and Tetra-binning explained: What are these features on the Galaxy S22 camera? appeared first on xda-developers.
description: Samsungg's latest Galaxy S22 phones have tetra-binning and nona-binning cameras, but what does that mean? Here's what they do.
